intro: Cheiridopsis littlewoodii, commonly known as the Littlewood's ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and specialized adaptations for arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are thick and succulent, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. It is often found growing in rocky, well-drained soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
